abstract: The company is the third major mobile phone carrier, after AT&T and Sprint, to settle with regulators over the practice, known as cramming.
snippet: The company is the third major mobile phone carrier, after AT&T and Sprint, to settle with regulators over the practice, known as cramming.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — T-Mobile on Friday agreed to pay at least $90 million to settle charges that it unlawfully billed customers for millions of dollars for unwanted premium text messages.

headline.main: T-Mobile to Pay $90 Million to Settle Claims of Wrongful Phone Charges
headline.print_headline: T-Mobile to Pay Fines for Wrongful Text Charges
